title: American_Top_40_1986_August_30th
description:
"You're hearing the biggest hits in the USA by the biggest recording acts from around the world."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

One song in the countdown sets a record by returning to the chart 22 years after its first chart appearance, unseating "White Christmas," by Bing Crosby which returned to the chart after a 20 year absence.

A listener asks, "How many black recording acts from Great Britain have hit the top 40 in the US, and who's the most successful?" The most successful act is in this countdown.

Belinda Carlisle has her first solo hit and the Monkees are on the chart with their first hit since 1969.

Casey gives a brief history of Run D.M.C.

Lionel Richie is in the top ten with his song, "Dancing On The Ceiling." Casey tells how Fred Astaire filmed a movie scene "dancing on the ceiling" way back in 1951.
